answers.answer: don't understand. do they need cut? could u post more information please? maybe then i could help
don't understand? do they need cut? could u post more information maybe then i could help.
This is a hallmark of insufficient oxygen, common with developing emphysema. You need a pulmonary consultation.
The curved fingernails are also characteristic of advanced COPD (Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease) and especially those who have smoked heavily for decades.

No they do not need to need to be cut. They always had a slight curve to them. Once they reached a certain length. But now even short my index finger mostly, curves downward drastically. I do smoke, have chronic bronchitis and type 2 diabetes.

question: My Fingernails Have Started To Bend Down And Curve
title: nails
